definition: (prefix indicating ordinal number, e.g. first, number two etc)/order/(old) rank in the imperial examinations/mansion/(literary) but/just
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
next in sequence/second/the second (day, time etc)/secondary/vice-/sub-/infra-/inferior quality/substandard/order/sequence/hypo- (chemistry)/classifier for enumerated events: time

pinyin: Di4 yi1 ci4 Shi4 jie4 Da4 zhan4

sentences.english: Twelve months' non-stop football is doing me well. I feel that I am still growing in form.
sentences.chinese: 這是我這幾年來第一次有這樣的感受。

sentences.english: Last fall, I had my first sleepover.
sentences.chinese: 去年秋天，我有了第一次外宿。

sentences.english: I first read this novella when I was in middle school.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次讀這篇短篇小說是在初中的時候。

sentences.english: Such had been his first dip into the dark abysses of existence.
sentences.chinese: 他第一次跌進人生黑暗深淵的情形就是這樣。

sentences.english: It was the first-ever direct communication from Bush to Kim.
sentences.chinese: 這是布什和金正日之間的第一次直接溝通。

sentences.english: This was probably the first time the Britons came into contact with other peoples.
sentences.chinese: 這或許是不列顛人第一次同外族人進行交往。

sentences.english: This is my first journey by the through train to Guangzhou .
sentences.chinese: 這是我第一次乘直達車去廣州。

sentences.english: "This is a first for the sub-glacial environment with that level of sophistication, " Ellis-Evans said.
sentences.chinese: 這是第一次對那麼複雜的冰下環境做勘測。

sentences.english: “The first was just a warning, ” Abrahim said.
sentences.chinese: “剛纔第一次不過是警告，”亞伯拉罕說。

sentences.english: After World War I, Syria became a French mandate.
sentences.chinese: 第一次世界大戰後，敘利亞成了法國的託管地。

sentences.english: On my first time I accidentally crashed into a snow boarder.
sentences.chinese: 第一次滑下來的時候我不小心撞上玩雪地滑板的人。

sentences.english: When he notices for the first time the faint.
sentences.chinese: 他第一次在圓形杯底的折射之中。

sentences.english: Over one hundred years later, golden fruit formed for the first time on the pale tree.
sentences.chinese: 一百多年後，白耀之樹第一次結出了金色果實。

sentences.english: The crabs broke this thin net at the first time.
sentences.chinese: 下第一次籠子之後螃蟹就將這個細網子弄破了。

sentences.english: The first wxdye were the Gaels -came about 600 BC.
sentences.chinese: 第一次高潮是約公元前600年蓋爾人的來臨。

sentences.english: Later came the first break in their restored home circle. The Dovecote
sentences.chinese: 不久，他們重新團聚起來的家就發生了第一次突破。

definition: for the first time/first (meeting, attempt etc)
next in sequence/second/the second (day, time etc)/secondary/vice-/sub-/infra-/inferior quality/substandard/order/sequence/hypo- (chemistry)/classifier for enumerated events: time
